page.title: 10Government of the area
page.content: The Government of the area is a bit mixed and confusing. There are three Councils: The County Council, the Borough Concil and in parts of the block Parish Councils. The County Council looks after the roads, clears away all the rubbish and waste, looks after the schools and pays the teachers, supplies the fire and police services. The Borough Council supplies the recreation facilities in the area and builds and maintains Council houses. In Milton and Kemsley it also looks after the roads. Parish Councils are in Iwade and Bobbing which supply the little things that people need, like bus shelters and seats but who also complain and suggest to the other councils what they can do to help in the villages. The children of Iwade and Bobbing like council elections because they have a day off school.
